bio: Gordon Ramsay is a British chef, restaurateur, and television personality. He has owned and operated a number of restaurants across the world and has won numerous awards for his culinary expertise.

recipes.name: Spicy Korean Fried Chicken
recipes.method:
Preheat oven to 400°F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
2. In a large bowl, mix together flour, salt, black pepper, garlic powder, paprika, and cayenne pepper.
3. Add chicken wings to the bowl and toss to coat with the flour mixture.
4. Place chicken wings on the baking sheet and bake for 25-30 minutes, until golden brown and cooked through.
5. While the chicken is baking, make the sauce. In a small saucepan, mix together gochujang sauce, honey, soy sauce, garlic, and ginger. Cook over low heat for 5 minutes

recipes.name: Spinach and Ricotta Stuffed Shells
ingredients: 1/2 cup frozen spinach, thawed and drained
recipes.method: Preheat oven to 375°F. Cook the jumbo pasta shells according to package instructions. In a large bowl, mix together ricotta cheese, parmesan cheese, egg, spinach, garlic powder, salt, and black pepper. Stuff the cooked shells with the cheese mixture and place them in a baking dish. Pour marinara sauce over the stuffed shells and top with shredded mozzarella cheese. Cover with foil and bake for 25-30 minutes. Remove the foil and bake for an additional 5-10 minutes, until the cheese is melted and bubbly.

recipes.name: Teriyaki Glazed Salmon
recipes.method: Preheat oven to 400°F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. In a small saucepan, mix together soy sauce, honey, rice vinegar, garlic powder, and ginger powder. Cook over low heat for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.Pour marinara sauce over the stuffed shells and top with shredded mozzarella cheese. Cover with foil and bake for 25-30 minutes. Remove the foil and bake for an additional 5-10 minutes, until the cheese is melted and bubbly.

bio: Julia Child was an American chef, author, and television personality. She is credited with bringing French cuisine to the American public with her cookbook, Mastering the Art of French Cooking, and her popular cooking show

recipes.name: Mushroom and Truffle Risotto
recipes.method:
In a large pot, heat the broth over medium heat and keep it warm. In a separate large pot, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the onion and garlic and cook until softened, about 5 minutes. Add the mushrooms and cook until they release their liquid and begin to brown, about 8 minutes. Add the Arborio rice and stir to coat in the butter and mushroom mixture. Add the white wine and stir until it is absorbed by the rice.
6. Begin adding the warm broth to the rice, about 1 cup at a time, stirring frequently and allowing the rice to absorb the broth before adding more.

recipes.name: Spicy Grilled Shrimp Tacos
ingredients: 1 lb large shrimp, peeled and deveined
recipes.method: Preheat a grill or grill pan to medium-high heat. In a medium bowl, combine the shrimp, olive oil, chili powder, cumin, smoked paprika, cayenne pepper, garlic powder, and salt. Toss to coat the shrimp. Grill the shrimp for 2-3 minutes per side, or until cooked through. Warm the tortillas on the grill or in a dry skillet over medium heat. Assemble the tacos by placing 2-3 shrimp on each tortilla, along with some shredded red cabbage, avocado slices, and chopped cilantro.

recipes.name: Honey Mustard Glazed Salmon
recipes.method: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. In a small bowl, whisk together the honey, Dijon mustard, whole grain mustard, olive oil, garlic, and dried thyme. Season the salmon fillets with salt and pepper, and place them skin-side down on the prepared baking sheet. Brush the honey mustard glaze over the top of each fillet, covering it evenly. Bake the salmon for 12-15 minutes

bio: Jamie Oliver is a British chef, restaurateur, and television personality. He is known for his approachable style of cooking and his campaign to improve school food in the UK

recipes.name: Vegetarian Pad Thai
ingredients: 1 block extra-firm tofu, pressed and cubed
recipes.method: Cook the pad Thai noodles according to package instructions. Drain and set aside. Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the tofu cubes and cook until golden brown on all sides, about 5-7 minutes.Remove the tofu from the skillet and set aside. In the same skillet, add the garlic and scallions and cook for 1-2 minutes, stirring constantly. Push the garlic and scallions to one side of the skillet and add the beaten eggs to the other side. Cook the eggs until set

recipes.name: Pesto Grilled Cheese Sandwich
recipes.method: Spread 1 tablespoon of pesto sauce on each slice of bread. Place a slice of mozzarella cheese on 2 slices of bread and top with the remaining slices of bread.. Heat a non-stick pan over medium heat.Spread 1/2 tablespoon of butter on the outside of each sandwich. Place the sandwiches in the pan and cook until golden brown on one side, about 2-3 minutes. Flip the sandwiches over and cook until the cheese is melted and the other side is golden brown, about 2-3 minutes more.

recipes.name: Greek Chicken Skewers
ingredients: 1 lb boneless, skinless chicken breast, cut into 1-inch pieces
recipes.method: In a large bowl, whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, red wine vinegar, garlic, oregano, thyme, salt, and black pepper. Add chicken pieces to the bowl and toss to coat evenly. Cover and marinate in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes or up to 4 hours. Preheat grill to medium-high heat. Thread chicken pieces, red onion, and bell pepper onto skewers, alternating as desired.Grill skewers for 8-10 minutes, turning occasionally, until chicken is cooked through and vegetables are tender.

bio: Ina Garten is an American chef, author, and television personality. She is known for her simple, elegant recipes and her show, Barefoot Contessa

recipes.name: Thai Red Curry with Vegetables
recipes.method: In a large pot, heat vegetable oil over medium-high heat. Add onion and garlic and cook until softened, about 2 minutes. Add Thai red curry paste and cook for 1 minute, stirring constantly. Add coconut milk and stir to combine. Add red bell pepper, yellow bell pepper, zucchini, and mushrooms and stir to combine. Add brown sugar, fish sauce, and lime juice and stir to combine. Bring the mixture to a simmer and cook for 10-15 minutes, until the vegetables are tender and the flavors have melded together. Remove from heat and stir in chopped cilantro.

recipes.name: Grilled Salmon with Mango Salsa
recipes.method: Preheat grill to medium-high heat. Brush salmon fillets with olive oil and sprinkle with salt and black pepper.. Grill salmon for 5-6 minutes per side, until cooked through. While the salmon is cooking, make the mango salsa. In a medium bowl, combine diced mangoes, red onion, red bell pepper, jalapeño pepper, chopped cilantro, and lime juice. Toss to combine and season with salt to taste.

recipes.name: Creamy Garlic Mushroom Chicken
recipes.method:
Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Season chicken breasts with salt and black pepper. Heat olive oil in an oven-safe skillet over medium-high heat.
4. Add chicken breasts and cook for 4-5 minutes per side, until golden brown. Remove chicken from skillet and set aside. In the same skillet, add sliced mushrooms and garlic and cook for 2-3 minutes, until mushrooms are tender. Add chicken broth and bring to a simmer, scraping up any browned bits from the bottom of the skillet. Add heavy cream and Parmesan cheese and stir to combine

bio: Anthony Bourdain was an American chef, author, and television personality. He rose to fame with his book, Kitchen Confidential, and went on to host several travel and food shows, including No Reservations and Parts Unknown.

recipes.name: Roasted Butternut Squash Soup
ingredients: 1 large butternut squash, peeled and diced
recipes.method: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). In a large bowl, toss diced butternut squash with chopped onion, minced garlic, and olive oil. Spread mixture out onto a baking sheet and roast in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, until squash is tender and caramelized. Transfer roasted squash and onion mixture to a large pot. Add chicken broth, cinnamon, nutmeg, salt, and black pepper. Bring to a simmer and cook for 15-20 minutes, until flavors are blended. Use an immersion blender

recipes.name: Mushroom and Spinach Stuffed Chicken Breast
recipes.method: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Season chicken breasts with salt and black pepper. In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium-high heat. Add sliced mushrooms and cook for 2-3 minutes, until tender. Add spinach leaves and garlic and cook for an additional 1-2 minutes, until spinach is wilted. Remove skillet from heat and stir in shredded mozzarella and grated Parmesan cheese.

recipes.name: Vegetarian Lentil Soup
ingredients: 1 cup green lentils, rinsed and drained
recipes.method: In a large pot or Dutch oven, heat olive oil over medium-high heat. Add chopped onion, carrots, and celery and cook for 5-7 minutes, until vegetables are tender. Add minced garlic and cook for an additional 1-2 minutes, until fragrant. Add rinsed and drained lentils, vegetable broth, ground cumin, smoked paprika, ground coriander, dried thyme, salt, and black pepper. Bring to a simmer and cook for 25-30 minutes, until lentils are tender and soup is thick and flavorful

bio: Nigella Lawson is a British chef, author, and television personality. She is known for her relaxed approach to cooking and her love of comfort food. She has hosted several cooking shows and written numerous cookbooks.

recipes.name: Quinoa Stuffed Bell Peppers
ingredients: 1 can black beans, drained and rinsed
recipes.method: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). In a large bowl, toss diced butternut squash with chopped onion, minced garlic, and olive oil. Spread mixture out onto a baking sheet and roast in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, until squash is tender and caramelized. Transfer roasted squash and onion mixture to a large pot. Add chicken broth, cinnamon, nutmeg, salt, and black pepper. Bring to a simmer and cook for 15-20 minutes, until flavors are blended. Use an immersion blender

recipes.name: Spinach and Ricotta Stuffed Shells
ingredients: 1/2 cup frozen spinach, thawed and drained
recipes.method: Preheat oven to 375°F. Cook the jumbo pasta shells according to package instructions. In a large bowl, mix together ricotta cheese, parmesan cheese, egg, spinach, garlic powder, salt, and black pepper. Stuff the cooked shells with the cheese mixture and place them in a baking dish. Pour marinara sauce over the stuffed shells and top with shredded mozzarella cheese. Cover with foil and bake for 25-30 minutes. Remove the foil and bake for an additional 5-10 minutes, until the cheese is melted and bubbly.

recipes.method: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. In a small bowl, whisk together the honey, Dijon mustard, whole grain mustard, olive oil, garlic, and dried thyme. Season the salmon fillets with salt and pepper, and place them skin-side down on the prepared baking sheet. Brush the honey mustard glaze over the top of each fillet, covering it evenly. Bake the salmon for 12-15 minutes
